timeline.author: david-allison-1
david-allison-1

timeline.bodyText:
Can we use Assume (http://junit.sourceforge.net/javadoc/org/junit/Assume.html) here? Assuming (hehe) it doesn't fail the build.
IME it's best to explicitly show that a test was ignored, rather than passing with a noop
timeline.author: david-allison-1

replies.bodyText:
Perhaps? I've never done that before. I agree with explicit ignore just wasn't even aware that trick existed
I'll wait to see what @Arthur-Milchior  wants to do with this as it was essentially a sketch of how to expose v2 to more testing with some possible failures already demonstrated
replies.author: mikehardy

timeline.message:
Parameterize the ContentProviderTest across both schedulers

Now we exercise SchedV2 a bit as well which should help
Note that it is having problems right now but hopefully
following commits will fix them

timeline.bodyText:
Can we use Utils.arrayList2array here (and in a few other places)?
Note: actually accepts List<T>
timeline.author: david-allison-1

timeline.bodyText: Is this in the right place?
timeline.author: david-allison-1

replies.bodyText: Yes, one of the AndroidStudio auto-refactors for system array copy was valid, the other one did not work correctly but I did not really investigate, just backed that one out and suppressed lint
replies.author: mikehardy

replies.bodyText: Does it actually suppress the lint error as it's after the affected line
replies.author: david-allison-1

replies.bodyText:
Yes it does, there were two copies there both lit up lint view in Android Studio.
First one transformed, no problem.
Second one did not. Backed out transform and marked it noinspection, it is for the for loop copy following the line, it definitely works.
replies.author: mikehardy

timeline.author: david-allison-1
david-allison-1

timeline.bodyText: This is marked as changed, but it looks the same - might just be whitespace?
timeline.author: david-allison-1

replies.bodyText: Yes I should have unticked the unnecessarily changed whitespace assertion, there were just some obvious uglinesses in there and I moved them, sorry
replies.author: mikehardy
